brief_title: Neotrofin for Treatment of Chemotherapy-Induced Peripheral Neuropathy
brief_summary: This study will assess the safety and efficacy of Neotrofin in treating the peripheral neuropathy that results from chemotherapy for cancer.
criteria: - Patient must have diagnosis of cancer and be receiving or have received chemotherapy that has resulted in sensory or motor neuropathy. - Sensory or motor neuropathy must be >/= grade 2 per Common Toxicity Criteria at baseline. - In patients diagnosed with multiple myeloma, grade 1 sensory or motor neuropathy is acceptable. - Patient must have normal hematological cell counts. - Patient must have a life expectancy of >/= 3 months.
